intro: Randia rolfei, commonly known as the velvetleaf or redroot, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by red, fleshy berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in disturbed soils. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is cultivated in some regions as a garden plant.
